intro: Lophanthus urticifolius, commonly known as the stinging nettle leaf lophanthus, is a perennial herb native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, lance-shaped leaves that often cause skin irritation upon contact. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in clusters, typically in shades of pink or white. Its growth habit is upright, with stems that can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Lophanthus urticifolius is often found in moist, disturbed soils along roadsides and in woodland edges.
